meanings.definition: The path or direction taken by something moving.
meanings.sent1: The cours of the ball was straight towards the goal.
meanings.sent2: She followed the cours of the winding road through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The cours of the ants marching in a line was quite fascinating.
meanings.sent4: The cours of time never stops, always moving forward.
meanings.sent5: The cours of the river carved a beautiful path through the valley.

meanings.definition: A series of lessons or lectures on a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: The cours on history covered ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: Students attended the cours on mathematics every Monday.
meanings.sent3: The cours on baking turned out to be a delicious experience.
meanings.sent4: The cours on astronomy opened up a whole new world of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The cours on painting inspired creativity in everyone.

meanings.definition: The regular movement of water in a river or stream.
meanings.sent1: The cours of the stream was gentle and soothing.
meanings.sent2: Fish swim against the cours of the river to reach their destination.
meanings.sent3: The cours of the waterfall created a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent4: The cours of the waves crashing against the shore was powerful.
meanings.sent5: The cours of the current carried the leaves downstream.
